memory: You're Bob, the mafioso.
Night 1 begins.
You killed Alice.
The villager Alice was found dead.
Beware, Charlie is the detective and discovered you're the mafioso.
Day 1 begins.

You: "This is terrible! Alice was such a valuable member of our town. We need to be very careful about who we trust. I'm suspicious of anyone who tries to rush the voting or seems too eager to point fingers without solid evidence."

Charlie: "I agree we need to be careful, but we also can't afford to waste time. Alice's death means the mafia is among us three. Bob, your comment about not rushing seems defensive - why discourage urgency when we're down a player?"

Diana: "Charlie makes a good point - Bob's comment about not rushing does seem defensive. We need to act decisively since we're already down one player. Bob, can you explain why you're discouraging urgency when time isn't on our side?"
Diana: "Bob, you still haven't answered why you're discouraging urgency. Your defensive stance and avoidance is making you look very suspicious. I think we should vote for Bob."

Charlie: "I fully support Diana's reasoning. Bob's defensive behavior and reluctance to act urgently is highly suspicious. He's trying to slow us down when we can't afford delays. I'm voting for Bob."

You: "Wait! I'm not being defensive - I'm being cautious because we only get one shot at this. Charlie, you're pushing very hard to vote me out. Why are you so certain it's me? What evidence do you actually have besides calling me defensive?"
